009
010package imagingbook.common.sift;
011
012
013import java.awt.Shape;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018
019/**
020 * SIFT descriptor.
021 * Added magnitude field and Comparable interface for easy sorting.
022 * 2020/10/04: Added scale level for display reasons.
023 * 
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2020/10/04
026 */
027public class SiftDescriptor implements Pnt2d, Comparable<SiftDescriptor> {
028        
029        private final double x; // image position
030        private final double y;
031        private final int scaleLevel;
032        private final double scale;
033        private final double magnitude;
034        private final double orientation;
035        private final int[] features;
036        
037        public double getX() {
038                return x;
039        }
040
041        public double getY() {
042                return y;
043        }
044
045        public double getScale() {
046                return scale;
047        }
048        
049        public int getScaleLevel() {
050                return scaleLevel;
051        }
052        
053        public double getMagnitude() {
054                return magnitude;
055        }
056
057        public double getOrientation() {
058                return orientation;
059        }
060        public int[] getFeatures() {
061                return features;
062        }
063
064        public SiftDescriptor(double x, double y, double scale, int scaleLevel, double magnitude, double orientation, int[] features) {
065                this.x = x;
066                this.y = y;
067                this.scale = scale;
068                this.scaleLevel = scaleLevel;
069                this.magnitude = magnitude;
070                this.orientation = orientation;
071                this.features = features;
072        }
073        
074        // -----------------------------
075        
076        public double getDistanceL1(SiftDescriptor other) {
077                int[] f1 = this.features;
078                int[] f2 = other.features;
079                int sum = 0;
080                for (int i=0; i<f1.length; i++) {
081                        sum = sum + Math.abs(f1[i] - f2[i]);
082                }
083                return sum;
084        }
085        
086        public double getDistanceL2(SiftDescriptor other) {
087                int[] f1 = this.features;
088                int[] f2 = other.features;
089                int sum = 0;
090                for (int i = 0; i < f1.length; i++) {
091                        int d = f1[i] - f2[i];
092                        sum = sum + d * d;
093                }
094                return Math.sqrt(sum);
095        }
096        
097        public double getDistanceLinf(SiftDescriptor other) {
098                int[] f1 = this.features;
099                int[] f2 = other.features;
100                int dmax = 0;
101                for (int i = 0; i < f1.length; i++) {
102                        int d = Math.abs(f1[i] - f2[i]);
103                        dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
104                }
105                return dmax;
106        }
107        
108        // -----------------------------
109        
110        @Override
111        public Shape getShape(double featureScale) {
112                final double DisplayAngleOffset = -Math.PI / 2;
113                double x = this.getX(); 
114                double y = this.getY();
115                double scale = featureScale * this.getScale();
116                double orient = this.getOrientation() + DisplayAngleOffset;
117                double sin = Math.sin(orient);
118                double cos = Math.cos(orient);
119                Path2D poly = new Path2D.Double();      
120                poly.moveTo(x + (sin - cos) * scale, y - (sin + cos) * scale);
121                poly.lineTo(x + (sin + cos) * scale, y + (sin - cos) * scale);
122                poly.lineTo(x, y);
123                poly.lineTo(x - (sin - cos) * scale, y + (sin + cos) * scale);
124                poly.lineTo(x - (sin + cos) * scale, y - (sin - cos) * scale);
125                poly.closePath();
126                return poly;
127        }
128        
129        // -----------------------------
130        
131        @Override
132        public String toString() {
133                return String.format(Locale.US, 
134                                "x=%.1f y=%.1f s=%.2f mag=%.4f angle=%.2f", 
135                                x, y, scale, magnitude, orientation);
136        }
137
138        //used for sorting SIFT descriptors by magnitude
139        @Override
140        public int compareTo(SiftDescriptor d2) {
141                if (this.magnitude > d2.magnitude) return -1;
142                if (this.magnitude < d2.magnitude) return 1;
143                else return 0;
144        }
145
146
147
148}
